question: 鶏
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you to remember: 

A <vocabulary>chicken</vocabulary> is a <reading><ja>庭</ja></reading> (garden) <reading><ja>鳥</ja></reading> (bird) (<ja>にわとり</ja>). It's a bird that you keep in your garden, after all!
